div.p: Here is a simple example of the use of the q element:
div.pre: The man said Things that are impossible just take longer. I disagreed with him.

div.p: Here is an example with both an explicit citation link in the q element, and an explicit citation outside:
div.pre: The W3C page About W3C says the W3C's mission is To lead the World Wide Web to its full potential by developing protocols and guidelines that ensure long-term growth for the Web. I disagree with this mission.

div.p: In the following example, the quotation itself contains a quotation:
div.pre: In Example One, he writes The man said Things that are impossible just take longer. I disagreed with him. Well, I disagree even more!

div.p: In the following example, quotation marks are used instead of the q element:
div.pre: His best argument was ❝I disagree❞, which I thought was laughable.

div.p: In the following example, there is no quote — the quotation marks are used to name a word. Use of the q element in this case would be inappropriate.
div.pre: The word "ineffable" could have been used to describe the disaster resulting from the campaign's mismanagement.
